thread.title: Investors Sour on International Stock Funds

author: Asjylyn Loder
title: Investors Sour on International Stock Funds
text: The strengthening U.S. economy and rising dollar is dimming investor enthusiasm for funds that buy international stocks. Investors bought just $533 million in world equity mutual funds and exchange-traded funds, which invest primarily in international stocks, in the week ended May 2. That was the slowest weekly pace since January 2017, according to the Investment Company Institute.
